name: "Star Trek: Enterprise" Pilot Quiz | Star Trek: Enterprise Season 1 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who played young Jonathan Archer in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
Marty Davis.

	All four actors were in the episode. Bakula played the adult Jonathan Archer, Moses played Archer's father in the opening scene, and Beaver played a Starfleet officer in a couple of scenes.  Moses appeared in one episode of the show "Bette" and as an unnamed "boy" in the short film "Luka" before his appearance in the 2-part "Enterprise" pilot. He never had another acting credit.

questions.text: An alien crash-landed on Earth, and was killed by a farmer in Oklahoma. What species was that alien?
questions.explanation:
Klingon.

	Chronologically it was the first appearance of a Klingon in "Star Trek". At that time no other Klingon had ever been to Earth, and no Earthling had left Earth's solar system.  "Enterprise" was a prequel to all other "Star Trek" shows of its time.

questions.text: What is the name of Captain Archer's beagle?
questions.explanation:
Porthos.

	It was the first time in "Star Trek" history that a dog has appeared on a star ship. The dog, Porthos, was named after one of "The Three Musketeers", a book written by Alexander Dumas.

questions.text: What food did Dr. Phlox tell Capt. Archer he enjoyed while on Earth?
questions.explanation:
Egg Drop Soup.

	Dr. Phlox was played by John Billingsley. He appeared in all 98 of the episodes of the series.  He was a Denobulon. His appearance was the first for his race across all variations of "Star Trek".

questions.text: What planet was the Enterprise's first voyage out of the Earth's solar system to?
questions.explanation:
Qo'noS.

	Qo'noS was the Klingon homeworld. Until the crashlanding on Earth, no human had ever encountered a Klingon. The planet is known as Kronos in English.

questions.text: What U.S. State is the Vulcan compound in?
questions.explanation:
California.

	T'Pol had spent nearly all of her time on Earth at the compound in Sausalito, California. She was a Vulcan and assigned to the Enterprise as a liaison between the races. She didn't like her human coworkers early in the series.  During dinner with Trip and Capt. Archer she mentioned not leaving the Vulcan compound much while on Earth.

questions.text: Who was the first human to attempt to speak in Klingon?
questions.explanation:
Ensign Hoshi Sato.

	Ensign Hoshi Sato, played by Linda Park, was the Earth's foremost specialist in linguistics. At the start of the episode she was on leave, teaching classes, but Capt. Archer enticed her back to Starfleet with a chance to be the first person to speak to a Klingon.  When the patient that they are taking back to the Klingon homeworld awakens, she attempts to talk in his language but is very bad at it.

questions.text: Which character grew up on starships, rather than on a planet?
questions.explanation:
Ensign Travis Mayweather.

	Ensign Travis Mayweather, played by Anthony Montgomery, is a "boomer" or person who lived most of their life in space. He talks with several other crew members about his experiences. He was growing up at a time when ships travelled very slow, so it took years to make voyages that would later take hours.

questions.text: What race were the two aliens who attacked the Klingon on Earth?
questions.explanation:
Suliban.

	The two soldiers were Suliban. Not much is known about them in this episode, but they are found out to be a nomadic species working with a faction to win a Temporal Cold War. In this episode, several Suliban soldiers were sent after the Klingon to find the location of a package he was delivering.

questions.text: Why did the Suliban woman kiss Capt. Archer?
questions.correct: She can tell if people are lying through close contact.
options: She was passing on genetic memories.
She was trying to poison him.
questions.explanation:
She can tell if people are lying through close contact.

	She was a former member of the Cabal that was trying to win the Temporal Cold War. She left the faction because she felt it was too high a price to pay to "evolve" as she said. She was working with the Klingon courier to get a message to his people to help swing the Temporal war away from her own people.
